name: Tomato Basil Tagliatelle
author: Lisawas
summary: A super easy, fresh, fast pasta dish that can be made as a main course or side dish.  I always try to make it with heirloom tomatoes when they are in season.
ingredients: ½ pound dry tagliatelle or wide fettucine pasta
directions: Stir together the tomatoes, basil, red wine vinegar, olive oil, and oregano in a bowl; allow mixture to stand at least 10 minutes
Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat
Once the water is boiling, stir in the tagliatelle pasta, and return to a boil
Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until cooked through, but still firm, about 8 minutes
Mix the hot cooked tagliatelle into the tomato mixture; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese to serve
